a loop 4 loops on hook yarn over and pull through all loops notes 1 read the pattern carefully before starting and circle the numbers that apply to your size 2 this pattern is worked from the bottom brim up 3 i recommend using stitch markers to mark the beginning st/space of each round of the beanie remember to move the stitch marker as you progress 4 the asterisk * indicates pattern repeats you will need to repeat all the instructions between the asterisks 5 this pattern is a multiple of 2 sts but i suggest that when modifying the size of your beanie increase or decrease your sts by 4 this is just so your decreases crown of the beanie will have even numbers of sts 6 if you want your beanie to be more fitted or slouchier add/deduct a few rounds to the body of the beanie before continuing with the decreases or shaping of the crown 7 you can also use any yarn weight in making this beanie making sure that you use the corresponding hook size that is on the yarn label strings and cuddles
